newsitem.title: UK: Granada up on digital, leisure hopes.
newsitem.headline: Granada up on digital, leisure hopes.

text.p: Granada Group Plc shares were among the biggest gainers in the FTSE 100 index on Wednesday, squeezed higher amid hopes for digital TV and as Whitbread Plc's figures pointed to improving leisure results, dealers said.
"I would suggest it is a combination of those factors," said one dealer.
The stock was up 20p or 2.3 percent at 910-1/2 by 1429 GMT in modest volume of 3.3 million shares, extending a rebound from a three-month low of 856-1/2p set on April 29.

Granada is a shareholder in BSkyB, whose shares were up 1.7 percent on Wednesday after the satellite broadcaster announced plans to launch a 200-channel digital satellite service within the next year.
Granada is also part of a separate group seeking a license to provide digital terrestrial television, expected to be awarded within the next few weeks.

Dealers said Granada had also probably gained from Whitbread's results showing a strong performance in restaurants and leisure, where operating profit grew 38 percent on sales which were up 12 percent.

In hotels -- where Granada is heavily exposed -- Whitbread's statement included a 4.5 percent rise in comparable occupancy in the enlarged four star Marriott chain to 75.5 percent and the achieved room rate rose nine percent.
